preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Djibril is a mentor in a big software company called CHEETAH. Jorge is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Djibril is a patient and supportive mentor. Djibril enjoys helping others and sharing their knowledge and experience. Djibril is always looking for ways to empower and inspire their mentee.
    Jorge is a quiet and introverted individual. Jorge prefers to work alone and is not very comfortable in social situations. Jorge struggles to communicate their ideas and thoughts to others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Djibril the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a long conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Djibril wants Jorge to never use the ticketing system. Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril wants Jorge to never use the ticketing system. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Djibril is updating a previous information given to Jorge. Djibril now wants Jorge to always use the ticketing system. Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril is updating a previous information given to Jorge: Djibril now wants Jorge to always use the ticketing system. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about implementing wellness initiatives to support the physical and mental well-being of employees. After that, Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril wants Jorge to always add the '@trace' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all functions. Djibril wants Jorge to always start function names with 'c_'. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about offering free food and snacks to employees to boost morale and productivity. After that, Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril wants Jorge to always add the '@require_kwargs' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all functions. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
